personal.name: Dhanvin Kadiir S
personal.bio: B.Tech CSBS student passionate about cybersecurity, networking, and building secure systems. Experienced in network infrastructure, malware analysis concepts, and modern tools like Docker and n8n.

projects.title: Network Intrusion Detection System (IDS)
projects.description: Analyzed live network traffic and packet data to identify malicious activities, detect potential intrusions, and understand threat behaviors on a network.

projects.title: Optical Fiber Fault Detection
projects.description: Investigated network failures by detecting downtime locations and connection faults within optical fiber cables to ensure network reliability.

projects.title: Malware Reverse Engineering & Cyber Attribution
projects.description: Currently reverse-engineering malware samples to analyze their core mechanics, map threat behaviors, and understand the origins of cyber attacks.

blogPosts.title: Securing Web Applications Against Modern Threats
blogPosts.excerpt: A deep dive into advanced security headers and how to protect applications from XSS, clickjacking, and other common attacks.

blogPosts.title: The Rise of Generative AI in Cybersecurity
blogPosts.excerpt: Exploring how Large Language Models (LLMs) are transforming both offensive cyber operations and defensive security automation strategies.

blogPosts.title: Implementing Zero Trust Architecture
blogPosts.excerpt: Why perimeter security is no longer enough and how organizations are shifting towards Zero Trust frameworks to mitigate expanding attack surfaces.

blogPosts.title: Quantum Computing: The Cryptography Threat horizon
blogPosts.excerpt: Analyzing the impending risks that quantum computers pose to modern public-key cryptography and the push for post-quantum resistant algorithms.

experience.company: BSNL - Rajiv Gandhi Memorial Telecom Training Centre
